body: `torch.Size()` really only exists for the tensor constructors to disambiguate size vs. data constructors. This binds to `torch.Size` but not `tuple`. We could remove this from here and do the disambiguation after the parsing in `tensor_new.cpp`, but we still need to handle it specially.
body_html: torch.Size() really only exists for the tensor constructors to disambiguate size vs. data constructors. This binds to torch.Size but not tuple. We could remove this from here and do the disambiguation after the parsing in tensor_new.cpp, but we still need to handle it specially.
body_text: torch.Size() really only exists for the tensor constructors to disambiguate size vs. data constructors. This binds to torch.Size but not tuple. We could remove this from here and do the disambiguation after the parsing in tensor_new.cpp, but we still need to handle it specially.
